column4: Here's a question... sometimes apps start flashing... and they -don't- stop.
How the heck do I get them to stop that? :(
what exactly do u mean by "flashing" ?
well, the part in the panel.  it flashses.
grows bright, and then goes dim
and it just keeps doing that...  again and again and again and again and again....
that will happen when the window demands attention, for instance whenever someone says your name in xchat, you will see the flashing
yes, I understand that.  but, it doesn't stop.
even after I look at it.
not to mention I don't really need a window to say look at me unless I really want to monitor it anyways :P
maybe if you change some settings you can make it stop, I don't use gnome, so I can't give you exact instructions
searching throught gconf-editor, can't seem to find anything ;(
I think this is a bug, have a look at this page: https://launchpad.net/products/libwnck/+bug/31134
staindtx wiki is kinda like a colloboratively edited website.  Very neat.
I found a way to disable it: https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+ticket/113
